text: I was surprised this didn't get more attention when it first came out. I went to see it in the theater, because I had heard the story about how George Foreman had a vision of God and turned his life around, from Mr. Angry Man to committed comeback king, and he got happy in the process. I wasn't disappointed. Not every movie is going to be the greatest thing ever made, and it doesn't need to be.

WOW POWERFUL MOVIE (SPOILER WARNING)

I Love Boxing… Simple Any Saturday Or Friday And I Hear There’s Live Boxing On Or There’s A Fight I’m Looking Forward To I’ll Watch It And When I Heard They Were Doing A George Foreman Movie I Was Excited Since George Foreman Is One Of My Favourite Boxers And Sadly When This Came Out I Was Expecting Much And Actually Thought It Be Bad But When The Movie Ended I Wanted To Watch Over And Over Again. The Film Shows Us The Life George Foreman From His Hard Early Life To His Fight With Joe Frazier In Jamaica Then To When He Lost To Muhammad Ali In Zaire To When He Became A Priest To Knocking Out Michael Moorer At Age 45. The Acting Is Actually Really Spot On And Khris Davis Who Plays George Foreman From Young To Old Is Actually Amazing And Did a Very Good Job The Only Minor Detail I Didn’t Like Was The Boxing Fights I don’t know I’m No Specialist On Fight Scenes But The Punches Didn’t Look Real Like The Actually Hit The Boxer But Really Thats The Only Thing… Obviously As Of August 2025 George Foreman Passed Away At Age 76 And Just Yesterday I Looked Back On The Movie For The 12 Time And Never Gets Old His Story Is So Inspiring And If You Love A Good Story With a Real Life Man’s Ups And Down And Love Boxing This Is For You. Overall 9.5/10 NOW GO AND GET A GEORGE FOREMAN GRILL !!!

This biographical sports drama tells the inspiring true story of George Foreman, who went from impoverished childhood, to Olympic gold medalist and World Heavyweight boxing champion.

After a near death experience, George retires from the ring, finds faith, and becomes a preacher. Financial hardships force him back into the ring, where at age 45, he becomes the oldest heavyweight champion in boxing history.

In honor of the recent passing of George Forman on March 21, I definitely recommend giving this film a watch. I found it to be a very entertaining, heartfelt, and inspiring film. The cast was great, there’s a fantastic message about what you can achieve with focus, determination, and perseverance. 

I also appreciated how it wasn’t just a movie about boxing, but a story about the power of faith.

The one thing Netflix does really well is bio pics and origin stories. This movie was entertaining, heartwarming and insightful. I had no idea that George Foreman had such a complicated life. A well written and well told story.
